Answer: I have considered the matter for decades (1980 to present).I know for absolute sure there are trillions of inhabited planets with evolving people. Some new, some extremely older, some like ours coming out of primitive era, some at countless advanced levels between us and the super advanced ones of extreme age.These planets are NOT all like earth. Some are larger, some smaller. Geography and resources differ. Atmospheres differ. Sunlight differs. The variety and abundance of the various mineral elements differs.Each mortal life form comparable to humans here was created and has evolved to functI have considered the matter for decades (1980 to present).I know for absolute sure there are trillions of inhabited planets with evolving people. Some new, some extremely older, some like ours coming out of primitive era, some at countless advanced levels between us and the super advanced ones of extreme age.These planets are NOT all like earth. Some are larger, some smaller. Geography and resources differ. Atmospheres differ. Sunlight differs. The variety and abundance of the various mineral elements differs.Each mortal life form comparable to humans here was created and has evolved to function best on their home sphere, not all spheres, and they will be different from us as to structure and physiology. Their plants and animals will be different. Some of these inhabited spheres are moons (one is close to us). Some few inhabited spheres have no atmosphere.I considered how their technology would develop and concluded they could have vastly different technology at any and all levels from our own level to the most advanced.On our own sphere we do not know how the great heavy stones in Egypt, Lebanon, Peru were moved and fitted, even with earthquake resistance and with surpassing skill.Their bodies work differently, their medicines would be different. Their DNA and genes all vary — they are constructed and have adapted for THEIR own spheres…I doubt any such inhabited sphere exists without any technology. Not to fight over definition of that word or your construal of it, they could have developed in a way beyond our electric and electromagnetic tech, or using it quite differently. They would have sciences unknown to us, even some spheres not greatly advanced.Mortal brains vary sphere to sphere, how beings think, what they experience differs.I do know the elements (periodic table) is the same on all mortal spheres — but there are places (higher space cosmos levels) where it is not the same. Mortals do not live there, albeit they may advance in afterlife to such levels.Therefore I see near infinite diversity as to technology and even the basic methods of life chores day to day. Not all earthlings build homes the same. Bamboo is used widely in Asia, and in Iraq there are floating houses. Aztecs had similar. England uses more stone, USA more lumber.Resources vary, see? People in cosmos do the best with what they have.Our flowers might not grow there. Does not mean they have no flowers of their own.Plant life here varies. Myanmar is different from Switzerland.If EARTH has such diversity, it is part of the proof of what I am saying about other places, see?Gravity and temperature ranges differ too. We have to take our minimal necessary environment into space, and likewise for extraterrestrials. Perhaps some use saucers with inside temp of 40 Celsius or others prefer 5 Celsius.Yes, some planets very similar to ours. But even those people have different histories, different events. Life not the same there. They do not speak English, nor Japanese, nor Russian language. Some science and tech may be like our own, but their civic institutions and most technology could be QUITE different, see?This means all of our own future here will be very interesting, and more so as WE ENCOUNTER OTHERS COSMICALLY.How very interesting life has become. They could know far more about some or all of the elements.I am ABSOLUTELY sure of what I have written here. 1980 to now = almost 4 decades of thought, and I have only summarized what I know.Space is transcendental to accommodate such variety, a last thought. Means there are many feasible Realities in the Space-time Cosmos. There are vast higher realities and a flawless Judicial System which operates perfectly when things go awry. God has Infinite Foresight. The Ancients of Days oversee this, but Christ likely executes The Judgment here. Check outAlso seeAll thoughts here are my own too. Still cannot afford books, and almost no college was allowed. Does NOT mean I am not equal to BS or MS. I am more than equal to those. There is such a thing as learning on one’s own, and our own ancients started that process, see? I have seen only Avatar short preview, cannot afford more. So, in one way you are more fortunate. You cannot live there, it was fiction. We have to solve The Planet Earth problem.Other peoples can do the same as well. Learn to have respect for others.‘Star Wars’ are 99% a fiction. The 1% originates right here, as to our locale.It appears many earthlings need to explore and develop their own innate powers of mind, body and spirit too. Many people are doing so and say this enables us to see other dimensions and to attain higher planes of consciousness, about 13, though going to 5th dimension is a great accomplishment for earthlings now. Apparently our planet will ‘translate’ to 5th dimension too, so we do not want to be left behind with the improgressive. To me, this leaves the question of children: You will not easily explain 5th dimension to baby, toddler, eh? I cannot imagine the celestial powers separating us from our kids under 18 either. So I feel sure there is some provision for our kids to accompany us which others are not mentioning. I am working on this myself, but I am single with no kids. I tend to share generously, so when I learn more, it will appear. You can trust me. Some of my answers may have pointers as to instructions on how to do this yourself with meditation-like techniques. I am at work on this, clicking away diligently. Further experience always yields better.I will share any best or better I find. I do TRUST First Source and Center or God, as you prefer. I’ve never found reason for questioning best intentions of God, in fact, so far have found infinite dedication to truth, goodness, beauty and merciful and loving tolerance for our slowness too. But we are doing better nowadays, perhaps getting a bit sharper too. I am optimistic, not unwarrantedly so. God says we can do these things, and Jesus said so likewise, see?Each extraterrestrial mortal person arrives there with differing talents and potentials too. The same as here. They are not all plumbers or chemists. Some do art, some music, and some are doctors. What they have to work with is not merely their available materials, but their special talents and learning (different from us) just like we bring all to bear here for ourselves. Lots of specialists everywhere, see?Some planets are unspeakably advanced. You would consider these (mistakenly) as Highest Heavens could you see them, but earth has a similar destiny. And there are true Heavens beyond through which we and they can all ascend. Ever more perfect and glorious, all of the way to Paradise.

Answer: What makes you think the Na’vi in Avatar don’t have technology?Notwithstanding their melee weaponry and animal husbandry, both of which count as technology, the neural interfaces that allow them to mind-meld with just about every other form of life on their planet, plus the neural network that makes up the thing they call Eywa are both things that very, very likely would not be able to evolve naturally, and would have required some kind of intelligent design to produce.Whether the Na’vi created it themselves long ago and then lost and forgot the technique, or something/someone else made it forWhat makes you think the Na’vi in Avatar don’t have technology?Notwithstanding their melee weaponry and animal husbandry, both of which count as technology, the neural interfaces that allow them to mind-meld with just about every other form of life on their planet, plus the neural network that makes up the thing they call Eywa are both things that very, very likely would not be able to evolve naturally, and would have required some kind of intelligent design to produce.Whether the Na’vi created it themselves long ago and then lost and forgot the technique, or something/someone else made it for them, this is biotechnology of supreme sophistication, at least as advanced, if not more so, than anything the humans brought to the table on Pandora.The final battle was won by the technologically superior side.

Answer: Q: Why dont humans keep evolving?A: We do. Our intestines are apparently the body parts that evolve fastest to adapt to the modern diet.Q: Are we at our final form,A: The only final form of any species is the one just before the species goes extinct.Q: should not another humanoid species of sorts, evolve as we did?A: There will either be a new hominid species after us, maybe Homo Nova or something; or there won’t be, and the hominids end with us.There’s a chance that another species may fill the niche of cooperative tool-using sapient beings after we’re gone. For instance, some wild chimpanzeeQ: Why dont humans keep evolving?A: We do. Our intestines are apparently the body parts that evolve fastest to adapt to the modern diet.Q: Are we at our final form,A: The only final form of any species is the one just before the species goes extinct.Q: should not another humanoid species of sorts, evolve as we did?A: There will either be a new hominid species after us, maybe Homo Nova or something; or there won’t be, and the hominids end with us.There’s a chance that another species may fill the niche of cooperative tool-using sapient beings after we’re gone. For instance, some wild chimpanzees have entered the earliest stone age using manufactured stone tools. But we can’t tell if they succeed, and right now, we’re in the way of their evolution. Simply put: we won’t let them succeed.That’s a thing in evolution: species evolve to survive. If a species evolve into a niche that’s already taken, then that species is at a disadvantage compared to the other species that is already in the niche and will be out-competed. So species generally don’t evolve into taken niches. They evolve in other ways, not because they choose to, but because they are more likely to survive and reproduce that way.

Answer: Couldn’t the humans in Avatar wipe out the Na’vi if they wanted?Yes.That was actually one of the biggest flaws of the whole movie.Let's say we humans one day become an interstellar species.And lets say that for a while that interestellar travel is done slower than light.Until we found a planet where an exotic ore existed, that would allow us to actually travel faster than light.But on that planet there is not just life, but also intelligent life.So we humans needed the ore, and we were willing to trade with the natives in order to get the ore we needed.But the natives didn't want to trade.SimpCouldn’t the humans in Avatar wipe out the Na’vi if they wanted?Yes.That was actually one of the biggest flaws of the whole movie.Let's say we humans one day become an interstellar species.And lets say that for a while that interestellar travel is done slower than light.Until we found a planet where an exotic ore existed, that would allow us to actually travel faster than light.But on that planet there is not just life, but also intelligent life.So we humans needed the ore, and we were willing to trade with the natives in order to get the ore we needed.But the natives didn't want to trade.Simple solution…That way the natives are gone, and we can mine the planet resources as we damn well pleased.Same could have been done on the movie Avatar.Which is why they should've gone to the trouble of explaining exactly why was unobtanium so important and some of its properties.In a five to ten minutes explanation they could've said something about how that ore, if contaminated by certain types of particles like fast moving neutrons would become mostly useless.That in its natural state, it needed to be mined carefully, until it could be used for human technology purposes.Thus explaining why they didn't simply nuked the entire planet from orbit.

Answer: In order to be BAD ASS MOTHERF*CKERS.Did you know that a human can chase down an antelope, easily, just by jogging after them?In order to be BAD ASS MOTHERF*CKERS.Did you know that a human can chase down an antelope, easily, just by jogging after them?One of the most BAD ASS MOTHERF*CKER things about our species is our ability to perform sustained aerobic exercise, for hours on end. It makes us into the Terminator, a relentless killing machine who will stride (or run) implacably towards its target, not stopping until that target is dead. If the animals could talk they would say “Oh god, it just never stops!”. This is calledThe key to this ability is something which is often unwanted, and not really appreciated for the amazing evolutionary advantage that is is:Look at this guy’s skin - it’s soaking wet.That water will turn from liquid into gas, and as it does so it will suck aIf you have fur, sweating just doesn’t really work - nowhere near as well, anyway. The evaporating water might cool your fur down, but it won’t cool your skin down, and thus won’t cool down the muscles underneath that skin, which are the things that really need to lose the heat.So, we lost our body hair in order to become more effective hunters: to become the animal-world equivalent of this guy.

Answer: Well, so did the Romans. While it is true that the Romans had a sketchy sewage system, this was by no means comparable to the modern ones. Cloaca maxima had been planned to drain the marshes part of Rome was built on. The water brought to Rome by its 11 acquaeducts were also emptied in the Cloaca maxima, after feeding the city’s public fountains, the public baths, and the baths in several private mansions. The public toilets were also connected to the Cloaca maxima, as a rivulet of water ran under the seats and along the central streamlet, used to clean the sponges the Romans used to clean theWell, so did the Romans. While it is true that the Romans had a sketchy sewage system, this was by no means comparable to the modern ones. Cloaca maxima had been planned to drain the marshes part of Rome was built on. The water brought to Rome by its 11 acquaeducts were also emptied in the Cloaca maxima, after feeding the city’s public fountains, the public baths, and the baths in several private mansions. The public toilets were also connected to the Cloaca maxima, as a rivulet of water ran under the seats and along the central streamlet, used to clean the sponges the Romans used to clean themselves, and women would empty the family’s chamberpot in the toilet if they contained any poop. If they contained only pee it was usually more convenient to empty it into the jars made available by the dyers (that had beaks for the men to pee directly into). Urine was essential for dyeing and whitening cloth. All other waste was just thrown into the street and left to decay until rain took it away.
